questions.question: Describe the basic structure of a Nucleotide

choices.answer: Deoxyribose, one of four bases C, T, A, G & a phosphate
Galactose, one of four bases C, T, A, G & a phosphate
Deoxyribose, one of four bases C, T, A, U & a phosphate
Deoxyribose, one of three bases C, T, A & a phosphate

questions.question: Describe the basic structure of a double stranded DNA molecule

choices.answer: 2 linear strands that are anti-parallel and fold together.
3 linear strands that are anti-parallel and twist together.
2 parallel that twist together.
2 linear strands that are anti-parallel and twist together.

questions.question: Explain how the structure of DNA supports it’s functions

choices.answer: Helps carry coded information for making ribosomes
Helps carry coded information for making proteins
Helps carry coded information for making cellulose
Helps carry coded information for making cytoplasm

questions.question: Describe the formation of a phosphodiester bridge in DNA replication

choices.answer: Pyrophosphates come together and catalyze the reaction
Pyrophosphates break away to stop the reaction
Pyrophosphates break away and catalyze the reaction
Pyrophospheres break away and catalyze the reaction

questions.question: Explain the basic concept of semiconservative replication

choices.answer: 2 copies each contain 1 original strand and 2 new strands
6 copy each contain 2 original strand and 4 new strand
4 copies each contain 2 original strand and 2 new strands
2 copies each contain 1 original strand and 1 new strand

questions.question: Explain the leading and lagging strands in DNA replication

choices.answer: Leading replicated continuously lagging rep discontinuously
Leading replicated discontinuously lagging rep continuously

questions.question: Describe the conditions in which DNA is found in the ‘B’ conformation

choices.answer: High humidity, low salt
Low humidity, high salt

questions.question: Name one place where multi-stranded DNA might be found

choices.answer: Cytoplasm
Chromosomes
Cellulose
Mitochondria

questions.question: Name three places where circular DNA is found

choices.answer: Plasmids, mitochondrial DNA & cellulose
Centrosomes, mitochondrial DNA & chloroplast DNA
Ribosomes, mitochondrial DNA & chloroplast DNA
Plasmids, mitochondrial DNA & chloroplast DNA
3 nucleotides which together form a unit of genetic code
1 nucleotide which together form a unit of genetic code
2 nucleotides which together form a unit of genetic code
4 nucleotides which together form a unit of genetic code

questions.question: Describe the basic concept of DNA transcription

choices.answer: Info in a strand of DNA is copied in a new molecule of tRNA
Info in a strand of DNA is copied in a new molecule of rRNA
Info in a strand of DNA is copied in a new molecule of mRNA
Info in a strand of DNA is copied in a new molecule of DNA

questions.question: Describe the basic structure of an RNA molecule (primary, secondary and tertiary)

choices.answer: Prim- Double, sec- cloverleaf, tertiary- fold of cloverleaf
Prim- Single, sec- cloverleaf, tertiary- fold of cloverleaf
Prim- Single, sec- maple leaf, tertiary- fold of maple leaf
Prim- Single, sec- cloverleaf, tertiary- cut of cloverleaf

questions.question: Describe and produce diagrams to explain the basic structure and function of mRNA tRNA and rRNA

choices.answer: mRNA-Single stranded RNA, tRNA- 2 subunits, rRNA- cloverleaf
mRNA-Double stranded RNA, tRNA- cloverleaf, rRNA- 2 subunits
mRNA-Single stranded rRNA, tRNA- cloverleaf, RNA- 2 subunits
mRNA-Single stranded RNA, tRNA- cloverleaf, rRNA- 2 subunits
Codes glucose proteins
Codes tRNA
Codes polypeptide proteins
Codes MRNA

questions.question: Transcribe the following DNA code: 5’ G A T C A A T C T 3’

choices.answer: 3’ C U A C U U A C A 5’
3’ C U A G U U A G A 5’

questions.question: Translate the following DNA code using the table below: 5’ G A U C A A U C U 3’

choices.answer: Ser-Gln-Ser
Asp-Gln-Asp
Asp-Gln-Ser

questions.question: Explain in basic terms the roles of ncRNA molecules

choices.answer: DNA molecule that is not translated into a protein
RNA molecule that is not translated into a sugar
RNA molecule that is not translated into a protein
